text: James Jimmy Kidega (born 16 August 1982) is an Ugandan former footballer who played as a midfielder. ==Early and personal life== Born in Jinja, his brother is Moses Oloya, who also played international football for Uganda. ==Career== Kidega played club football for SC Villa, Express, Rayon Sports, La Passe, Gulu United, Uganda Revenue Authority, Chanthaburi and Bontang. He also earned two caps for the Ugandan national team. ==References== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Ugandan footballers Category:Uganda international footballers Category:SC Villa players Category:Express FC players Category:Rayon Sports F.C. players Category:La Passe FC players Category:Gulu United FC players Category:Uganda Revenue Authority SC players Category:Chanthaburi F.C. players Category:Bontang FC players Category:Association football midfielders Category:Ugandan expatriate footballers Category:Ugandan expatriate sportspeople in Rwanda Category:Expatriate footballers in Rwanda Category:Ugandan expatriate sportspeople in Seychelles Category:Expatriate footballers in Seychelles Category:Ugandan expatriate sportspeople in Thailand Category:Expatriate footballers in Thailand Category:Ugandan expatriate sportspeople in Indonesia Category:Expatriate footballers in Indonesia
title: Jimmy Kidega
